Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk dracut
exit 0

exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: dracut bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The dracut packages include an event-driven initramfs generator infrastructure based on the udev device manager. The virtual file system, initramfs, is loaded together with the kernel at boot time and initializes the system, so it can read and boot from the root partition. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, when the initramfs infrastructure expected a new device to be loaded during a system boot, it triggered the systemd daemon to reload the configuration. However, systemd could not handle the reload at that point, which caused the boot to fail. With this update, systemd is no longer triggered to reload the configuration in the described scenario, and the booting process thus proceeds as expected. (BZ#1144066) Prior to this update, interface names based on the position of the device in the hardware were bound to the media access control (MAC) address via the HWADDR directive. As a consequence, the MAC binding rendered the position-based naming useless, and swapping a PCI network card required the card to be reconfigured. With this update, dracut no longer assigns MAC address binding to interfaces with HWADDR. As a result, persistent interface names do not depend on the MAC address, and swapping a PCI network card does not require rewriting the configuration. (BZ#1135478) Users of dracut are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
